alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 05 at 4:27AM PST until January 07 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SATURDAY TO 9 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and large breaking waves of 4 to 8 feet Saturday, increasing to 7 to 10 feet late Saturday night. The highest surf will be on west facing beaches, such as shores stretching from Channel Islands Harbor to the Ventura Pier. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From 2 AM Saturday to 9 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Minor nuisance flooding is possible on Sunday morning during early morning tides at 5-6 AM.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
